oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: C.M. Hall of Fame Luncheon at the Governor's Mansion 1999-09-23 Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of the Country Music Hall of Fame Luncheon at the Governor's Mansion. The luncheon features a performance from Marty Stuart (musician), Cindy Walker (musician) and Randy Scruggs (musician). Additionally, the luncheon features speakers: Kyle Young (C. M. president), Don Sundquist (governor), Bruce Hilton, Sherry Bond, and Susan Bond. The luncheon is for the winners of the Country Music Association Awards and the opening of the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on 5th Ave. Nashville, Tennessee. The recording is from September 23, 1999. The tape is part 2 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Don Sundquist; Kyle Young; Marty Stuart; Bruce Hilton; Sherry Bond; Susan Bond; Loretta Lynn; Cindy Walker; Randy Scruggs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Marty Stuart praises Conway Twitty's single track records -- (02:16) Loretta Lynn reflects on Twitty's tenacity and drive; additionally, Twitty's growing ambitions are discussed -- (05:32) Kyle Young invites Don Sundquist and Martha Sundquist up to receive a crystal dinner bell -- (06:18) Sundquist invites the Country Music Hall of Fame to return each year and reflects on visiting Normandy, France -- (07:46) Marty Stuart reflects on "Will the Circle be Unbroken" being the campaign slogan for the Country Music Hall of Fame; additionally, Stuart asks the members of the Country Music Hall of Fame to come sing "Will the Circle be Unbroken" -- (09:18) Cindy Walker thanks Sundquist -- (10:08) Will the Circle be unbroken (Randy Scruggs, Marty Stuart, Cindy Walker, among other Country Music Hall of Fame members) -- (12:57) Young says goodbye to the various attendees -- (13:16) Young requests that the members of the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum gather for a photo
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Sundquist, Don; Young, Kyle; Hilton, Bruce; Bond, Sherry; Bond, Susan;
